entrance.title: Reading Room
entrance.description: You are standing in a reading room. There are some desks and chairs on soft carpeted floor, tall shelves line the walls. There is a door behind a counter to the North.

items.name: Leaflet
items.description: The leaflet reads: “Tate Archive collects and makes accessible a wealth of material primarily relating to the history of British art from 1900 to the present.”

items.name: Desk
items.description: They are hardwood desks of massive construction with a leather writing surface laid into the top.

items.name: Chair
items.description: The chairs are made of polished steel and soft black leather. Very heavy.

items.name: Counter
items.description: The counter is chest-high, with dark-grey linoleum sides and an oak top. Leaflets are stacked in one corner.

items.name: Shelves
items.description: The shelves reach from floor to ceiling. They are filled with green binders.

visibleItems.description: Its a green binder. The contents are useless.
visibleItems.name: Green Binder

items.name: Floor
items.description: The light-grey carpet is so dense you can barely hear your own footsteps.

corridor1.title: Corridor
corridor1.description: You are in a brightly-lit corridor. You see a narrow desk to one side. The walls on either side are made of steel wire mesh painted white, beyond which rows of storage shelves are visible. There is a door to the East.

items.description: Utilitarian. Empty boxes, stacks of documents, paper files, various stationary, and a single blue rubber glove are scattered across the surface.
items.searchDescription: You search the desk. After a little while, you find an access card under a stack of acquisition forms.

hiddenItems.name: Access Card (Level 2)
hiddenItems.description: An access card similar to yours.

items.description: Steel wire mesh, painted white. They look solid.
It's made of the same steel wire mesh as the walls, with steel security hinges. A card-reader is attached to the wall next to it.

keys.message: The door has no visible lock — must be electronic.

accesscard.message: A second after you hold the card up to the reader, a small light flashes green and the electronic lock on the door springs open.

store1.title: Red Store
store1.description: You're in a vast storage room lit by neon tubes. There is a row of 14 light-grey shelves mounted on steel tracks embedded into the floor. Each shelf has a label and a circular handle attached to the side facing you. You hear a humming noise from the climate control system.

items.descriprion: Steel, polished to a high sheen by repeated use.
You pick up a random box from the shelf. Opening it reveals a stack of neat paper files.

store2.title: Blue Store
store2.description: Another store room. It looks identical to the first one, except the shelves here are blue.

store3.title: White Store
store3.description: Another store. It looks identical to the two others, except the shelves here are white.

quarantine.title: Quarantine
quarantine.description: This is where boxes of archive material are checked for bugs and mould before we move them into permanent storage.

loadingDock.title: Loading Dock
loadingDock.description: The loading dock has space for two trucks, though it is currently empty. A raised concrete platform allows level access to whatever goods are being delivered. A handful of steps lead down to streetlevel.

initialInventory.name: Keys
initialInventory.description: They're your housekeys, probably of little use in the archive.

init: You are the archivist. Find TGA431. Start by typing “look around”, or type “help” to show a list of available commands.
help: You're playing a text adventure. It works much like modern videogames, except you control your character by typing text commands into the box at the bottom of the screen. Most valid commands come in the form of “[verb]” or “[verb] [noun].” /n /n Nouns /n Most things in the game world can be referenced by their name. Type “look at [noun]” to get details about any given item you encounter. When you enter a new location, some objects may be hidden. Examine your surroundings to reveal them. /n/n Verbs /n Common verbs include “go”, “take”, “look”, “search”, and “use”, but additional verbs may become available in certain situations. /n/n Movement/n To move your character around the game world, type “go” followed by a compass direction. For instance, “go north” will move your character to the north. Read the descriptions of your surroundings closely to find out where you can go. /n/n Inventory /n You can pick up objects you encounter throughout the game by typing “take [noun]”. These will be added to your inventory. To see what you're carrying, type “inventory”. To use items on your inventory, type a command in the form “use [noun] on [noun]”, for instance: “use key on door”.  /n/n Other useful commands /n Type “reset” to start over, and “help” to display this message.
cantGoThatWay: You can't go in that direction
cantTakeThat: Better to leave that where it is.
didntUnderstand: That's not a word I know.
That's not a word I recognise.
noSuchThing: There is no such thing here.
You can't see any such thing.
itemDidntWork: I don't think that would work.
giveCompass: You'll have to say which compass direction to go in.
giveTarget: You'll have to say what you want to use the % on.
hint: Remember you can type “help” to view a list of available commands. If you're stuck, maybe look at your surroundings by typing “look around”.
